member.name: T:Jacobi.Vst.Interop.Host.VstAudioPrecisionBufferManager
member.summary: The VstAudioPrecisionBufferManager class manages one continues block of unmanaged memory to service a number of audio buffers.
member.remarks: The class is instantiated specifying the number and size of buffers that can be accessed using the method. The life time of the unmanaged memory that backs up the buffers is coupled to the life time of the VstAudioPrecisionBufferManager instance. Calling the method will free the unmanaged memory.

members.member: Platform-independent definition of Virtual Keys (used in #VstKeyCode).
\deprecated Structure used for #openWindow and #closeWindow (deprecated in VST 2.4).

User-defined speaker types, to be extended in the negative range. Will be handled as their corresponding speaker types with abs values: e.g abs(#kSpeakerU1) == #kSpeakerL, abs(#kSpeakerU2) == #kSpeakerR)

Speaker Properties. The origin for azimuth is right (as by math conventions dealing with radians). The elevation origin is also right, visualizing a rotation of a circle across the -pi/pi axis of the horizontal circle. Thus, an elevation of -pi/2 corresponds to bottom, and a speaker standing on the left, and 'beaming' upwards would have an azimuth of -pi, and an elevation of pi/2. For user interface representation, grads are more likely to be used, and the origins will obviously 'shift' accordingly.
Symbolic precision constants used for effSetProcessPrecision.
VST 2.x dispatcher Opcodes (Host to Plug-in). Extension of #AEffectOpcodes
VST 2.x dispatcher Opcodes (Plug-in to Host). Extension of #AudioMasterOpcodes

VstTimeInfo requested via #audioMasterGetTime. @see AudioEffectX::getTimeInfo

ote VstTimeInfo::samplePos :Current Position. It must always be valid, and should not cost a lot to ask for. The sample position is ahead of the time displayed to the user. In sequencer stop mode, its value does not change. A 32 bit integer is too small for sample positions, and it's a double to make it easier to convert between ppq and samples. 
ote VstTimeInfo::ppqPos : At tempo 120, 1 quarter makes 1/2 second, so 2.0 ppq translates to 48000 samples at 48kHz sample rate. .25 ppq is one sixteenth note then. if you need something like 480ppq, you simply multiply ppq by that scaler. 
ote VstTimeInfo::barStartPos : Say we're at bars/beats readout 3.3.3. That's 2 bars + 2 q + 2 sixteenth, makes 2 * 4 + 2 + .25 = 10.25 ppq. at tempo 120, that's 10.25 * .5 = 5.125 seconds, times 48000 = 246000 samples (if my calculator servers me well :-). 
ote VstTimeInfo::samplesToNextClock : MIDI Clock Resolution (24 per Quarter Note), can be negative the distance to the next midi clock (24 ppq, pulses per quarter) in samples. unless samplePos falls precicely on a midi clock, this will either be negative such that the previous MIDI clock is addressed, or positive when referencing the following (future) MIDI clock.
MIDI Sysex Event (to be casted from #VstEvent).
MIDI Event (to be casted from VstEvent).
A block of events for the current processed audio block.
String length limits (in characters excl. 0 byte).
String concatenation taking care of null terminator.
String copy taking care of null terminator.
String length limits (in characters excl. 0 byte)
Process double-precision audio samples in replacing mode @see AudioEffect::processDoubleReplacing
Process audio samples in replacing mode @see AudioEffect::processReplacing
Returns current value of automatable parameter @see AudioEffect::getParameter
Set new value of automatable parameter @see AudioEffect::setParameter
\deprecated Accumulating process mode is deprecated in VST 2.4! Use AEffect::processReplacing instead!
@endcond Four Character Constant (for AEffect->uniqueID) AEffect magic number Basic VST Effect "C" Interface.

Define SDK Version (you can generate different versions (from 2.0 to 2.4) of this SDK by setting the unwanted extensions to 0). Current VST Version Disable for Hosts to serve Plug-ins below VST 2.4 Declares identifier as deprecated. Define for 64 Bit Platform.

member.summary: Creates a context using the specified and .

A reference to a host supplied implementation of the host command stub. Must not be null.
member.remarks: Note that when the implements it is also disposed when this instance of the plugin context is disposed.
member.exception: Thrown when the file specified in does not exist.
Thrown when the library cannot be opened.
Thrown when the library does not expose a VSTPluginMain exported function.
Thrown when the library does not return an ::EAffect pointer from its exported main function.
Thrown when the library does not specify the correct magic number in the ::EAffect structure or when it does not support VST version 2.4.

member.name: T:Jacobi.Vst.Interop.Host.VstPluginContext
member.summary: The VstPluginContext class represents a VST Plugin for the host.
member.remarks:
The VstPluginContext can only be created using the static
factory method. The method accepts the path to the plugin and an implementation of the interface. Note that Open is not called on the Plugin by the context but it does call Close on the plugin when the context is disposed.

member.param: The number of buffers.
The size of a single buffer.

member.name: T:Jacobi.Vst.Interop.Host.VstAudioBufferManager
member.summary: The VstAudioBufferManager class manages one continues block of unmanaged memory to service a number of audio buffers.
member.remarks: The class is instantiated specifying the number and size of buffers that can be accessed using the method. The life time of the unmanaged memory that backs up the buffers is coupled to the life time of the VstAudioBufferManager instance. Calling the method will free the unmanaged memory.
